column5: I couldn't really say I know what I say.... Don't think there's anything "regularly" said on a hook-up.  A couple times I've broken into some Shania Twain with "Man, it feels like a walleye."  I got potty mouth.  Not really that often except when excited, tired or buzzed.  Cover your ears kiddies, here's all I could find in the archives to prove my point.  http://s319.photobucket.com/albums/mm477/M...rent=PYM009.flv  And here's an oldy but goody.  I ain't playing the fish but I'm still the one cussing in the end. lol.  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vO_TBqdTAps
When I hook a big fish my partner in the boat sometimes asks... "Did you fart."  It's embarrassing... cause usually it's more like a "shart,"... then we go to shore.
Baaaahhhh talk about hitting the nail on the head..

Ask Solo what I said every time I stuck another silver in Alaska while fly fishing. I think it went UGGGHHH, there he is!!! It's all in the grunt!!!  Another one is FEEEEEEEEESH AWWWWWNNN, COMIN' DOWN!!!!!
Definitely a grunt followed by some hyperventilating, then "watch out she's coming your way!"
If I said something after every bite I'd be hoarse before lunch.
Today's first comment was "what the heck is that thing bending my rod?"
FISH ON  FISH  YEP!  depends on what comes out

Fish are smarter creatures then we give them credit for. So my comments are generally related to when the fish hits.  Like "Nice of you to show up now" which is generally spoken when I'm either fiddling with some tackle or clothing issues.  Or "dude" which is a standard response saved for those extra special hits. You know...the ones you get while fuming over the worst birdsnest human eyes have ever seen or trying to pour a coffee with cold fingers in a rocking boat or my personal FAV...while taking a whizz. And not just any whizz...it's ALWAYS the whizz where you took forever to just get the layers of cloths off..your sweating from the effort..the stream just starts...and them WHAM!!!!  Those little buggers know when you have your guard down.
LOL that is so true Steve.  Why do u think i keep jigging while i line a pail
Well at least now I know your secret.

Lol twenty years of pier chucking that one is ingrained in me. Usually it's just common sense, but early in the season 04:00 there isn't a soul there.  Get 5 min into the fight, through all the "COMIN' UP COMIN' UP FISH COMIN' UP!" I realize I'm the only person there, look behind me and there's a pair of raccoons that have stopped their scavenging through a garbage can and are looking at me like I'm on crack.
LOL!
dang...stuck on bottom again...uh, wait a minute  or  pretty sure its just weeds
Thank you Mistress,  May I have another.  *Wack*
Good one Riz,  90% of the time!!  LOL
BIRD ON!!
"Fish On!"  but my fave is Roland Martin's "SON!"
you're right goteeboy, I like/use the Roland Martin  Oooooh son, that's a biggun

I usually say "There we go" and sometimes "got one" or "there's one"...   If it feels small I wont say anything else unless someone asks.  If it feels decent I'll say "Oh ya, it feels like a good one".
There we go!! Fish on !!!!
The way my fishing was last summer it was usually "What the hell?".  JF
"Wayne, Terry! Wake up, I've got another one!"
I usually say "fish on"
I tend to laugh histaricly, lol kinda weird but i like fish...   CThey say that one glare from chuck Norris will liquify your kidneys
If i hook into one, I usually say: "FINALLY! Ive been freezing out here ALL DAY- you'd better be at least thissss big!"

Usually I just kinda grunt UH there's one! But if the fishing is hot I'll kindly stoop to the immortal words spoken by Roland Martin..."OHHH SONNNN!".Just seems appropriate when fishing for bass. Kerry
FISH!!!!
Fish!
what I say see I got another, I'm not the jinx after all

"THERE'S ONE."  tone of voice would depend on the size..  Every once in a while I'll say it while I'm setting the hook on a bruiser and I'm told it sounds like I'm riding the porcelain bus and i'm having some problems..  Other times it's more bassy like Barry White..  ooohhh baby.  Good thread!!  HD
i think i mutter a yup or yea on the hookset but am partial to:  "Another one for Millosh" to taunt those fishing with me after the fish is in the boat/on the ice.
oh theres one!!!! what is it now 7 to 0  to my partner  LOL!!!!   then the next   oh theres one!!!!  what is it now I am cathing so many i lost count LOL!!

if its been a slow day then..... There's one about time!!  If it is the first cats of the day.....were going to kill em today......then 3 hours later you inevitably catch the next one.  If its been a hot bite for me then ........ Hey you want to reel this one in ( to my partner)
"Fish!" or "Fish On!" or "Big Fish!" haha.. if i'm quiet when I get a strike, chances are that it's something small..

If I get just a "bump" while carp fishing I usually use British Steve's  "C'mon take it...take it" and rub my fingers together...  During the first big run it's usually "WHOA...Easy does it there Charlie Brown" or "Hey...this one's got shoulders"...
hmmm...thats odd
Like many others, it varies...  fish on! got em! oh yeah! here we go!  (usually reserved for hard running species)  right about know though....I think I would yell "it's about time!"
"quick! Grab my rod before it goes in! hurry! Grab it!"
Finally  Its about damn time  I think I have weeds  Snagged!  Probably a perch,  we use that for everything because we have caught perch on lures twice the size of them while trolling.
Reel My Friend Reel  Whens its Dano and Wayne............ Dont Wreck em
Ahh Marc, they question was when you hook a fish.   Not when some American "friend" hooks a fish.

Depends on what im fishing for... trolling superior with riggers "hey hey hey", summer walleye "nice one" winter if its a tip up, i usually hollar loud enough when im running for the whole lake to hear "tip up", or if im jigging and i get one, i will say "put on your (lure on the line), he's using a (lure on the line)"  all of which has ton of foul language.  i really have to watch myself sometimes.
In your case,I ask you Dad for assistance  If my memory serves me correct he syas "dont Be afraid"
I hope this snag takes a run!
get the net!
I have limited out MANY times on snags.
Like a few others, I'm a "there's one" guy. Don't ask me what I say when I lose a fish.
I say  "Whoa Baby, we're gonna need a bigger boat!"   or on the tribs.."Fish On"

I say "There is a fish" followed by "that's what we came for"   or   "that's what I am talking about"  when fishing a tournament with friends only and they are in earshot (within a mile) I just yell as loud as I can usually "YEAH!!!!" followed again with "THAT'S WHAT I AM TALKIN ABOUT!!!"  When fish aren't biting I just yell a bit  "COME OOOOOOOONN FISH!"
"HEY TERRY... I've got another one" !! lol

in the river...There we go!!!!!followed with a Fish On !!! On the boat...WAKE UP!!!!!!! FISH ON !!! ( sometimes i use the boat one even if there isnt a fish on ....just for fun ....it amuses me to see people wake from a dead sleep and try to get to a rod
I have a few but the most common is... "Well it's about time!" Occasionaly I get to say... "That was quick!"
FISH ON!  but when i lose one, i tend to swear then whip my rod into the water..
I never say the same thing twice ... bad luck!  There are some funny stories about this.. but they'd have to be told in person. Not politically correct enough for a public forum.
I tend to always say " YESSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS", but I've also been known to say a few of the same things camillej says
"Got him"
There's one...
" oh no , not another rock bass '

Steelheading when I first notice a bite starting. I usually go "you know you waaaannntttt IT. Once I set the hook and fight it for about 20 seconds then I go FISH ON. I really have to learn how to say that is a bunch of different dialects though because lots of times people don't seem to understand me. So they leave their lines in the way which then affords them opportunity to hear a multitude of swear words that I know directed at them... which they do seem to understand because they finally do then get their lines out of the way.  If I am bass fishing I turn to whoever else is there and say now you are down by how many ever fish they are behind. This is only because I always catch the most bass and it is always helpful to remind the other angler who is king of the river LOL.

I have more fun driving my partner crazy after just casting by asking "did you see that" and he will say "what" and I will remark "ANOTHER EXCELLENT CAST".  After doing this a about a dozen times throughout the day it gets annoying but very funny at times.
My remarks come only when what I have to say is better than silence.  Let's not underestimate the value of silence on the water.
GREAT POST!  never thought about it before...will have to get back to ya....lol....
You guys are lucky.  I usually say something like..."I don't believe it. I think I got something"  or "Well, it's about time" or "Don't make me come down there".

funny, now that I think about it, I tend to say lots of different things....  when fishing with bait...and getting lots of nibbles, I say.."come on..eat it!...eat it!...didn't your momma ever tell you not to play with your food?.......that's better...I'm in!!!!"  when fishing with lures for pike for example....." oh ya!...that one hammered it!"  when big water trolling and the action is fast and furious with rods popping off everywhere...just holler out what ever rod is going off...."inside dipsy!!!!!"....."watch the rigger!!!!"..." who's up?"  when drifting the river for steelies in the boat and doing lots of bottom boucing.." there's one for sure this time!"  couple other things come to mind...."that one gorfed it"........" he just inhaled it that time!"
Get the butter
I guess I must be about the only one that yells "Bingo" when a big one hits.  I don't play bingo but still use the word to indicate a winner.
lol
Id have to say my go to saying is a simple "OH YA!!"   is good too!
ADDABOY!!!
Ya I'm generic like that.... Followed by either "Yup...she a big one", or "bah...she's a runt"  And a classic unintended release..."Son of a gun!!!"
Last couple were sheephead, "Phil get that"?

I dunno why, but I really noticed this while I was down in the US fishing for steel with Solo.  Anytime I'd hook a fish I'd say "There we go!"  I have a feeling I say this all the time!  I think Cliff can also confirm this.  BTW, Cliff doesn't say a thing when he hooks into one, he's like Chuck Norris  When I release fish I usually call them sweetheart if it's a hen or  'big guy' if it's a male... I think there is something wrong with me.
I was told my line is "Here we go!!LOL
when i set the hook i say "FRIEND" then followed by "a new friend for us in the boat"
There's one or just Fish!
Who's Your Daddy!

LOL Bill     When I get a hit and set the hook i say "FISH ON" and if it's a decent one I say "GOT SOME SPUNK"  As soon as I release it I say "THANK YOU FOR THE FIGHT"  I don't know.... just an instant chain reaction Leechman
"Fish"  Bill, I don't even call my wife a sweetheart, let alone a fish...  I'm guess I'm not as sensitive as you!  Paul
in the summer .... i think i say ... there's one or get the net in the winter ... I stay as quiet as possible to prevent swarms of people rushing into my area   ...
Now that I think about it I usually say "yeehaa" or "oh baby" lol....  Burt
I think I say "there's one" most of the time,  and when it been slow and I finally get one I usually say "ahh hell there's one"
I always yell 'Get the camera!' to my friends who fish with me  haha

If it's a little'un I say "HA!" If it's a decent or good one, I say "Ugh!!!...There's one!"  If it's a little baby catfish when I get it to the top, I sing the baby catfish song  Catfish! Catfish! He's a little ratfish!
If I catch one using a Senko, I say, YAMASENKO!
Lol I use foul language!!! Bill knows.  Eh Bill what do you say when you losse one? Lol good times.

Spoken like a true bass guy.LOL   It,s either fish on,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,followed by a,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,fish off.  or  It,s fish on,nice one,oh ya,nice one,hey stay down,ok come here. Oh man yer just a dink.LOL   My favorite is,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,Theres another one Terry.

When fishing musky the guys would laugh at me when trolling I would just holler ROD OFF they want me to say FISH ON but heck I dont know that yet I just know there is a rod screaming line so she went off.
If you'll hold yer rod tip in the water they'll stay down... do I have to teach you everything???

Depends on where I am...and what I'm fishing for...  - Creek, sharing hole with strangers "Fish on!" to let them know to watch their lines. - Boat for smaller fish.  I'll say "got one" - Shore with Bly "Get the net!" - Boat for Muskie. "Holy ...dont lose it!"
I have a foul mouth, lets just say that  We gotta get out again man!

In the hut .... "hold my beer"  In Quebec .... "move your beer"  On the Dock ... "bring me a beer"  In a trib "beer-on !"   ... I think my daughters will attest .. my most common line ... would have to be ... "WHO's Your Daddy ?"
Hey, you gots to teach me nutt,n Dawg. I have the rod and half the reel in the water to keep them down at times.
i say "got em"
i say "got em"

For me it's "got im" which is quickly followed by me trying to chase away the fish theiving dog before she rips it off the line.    When fish aren't biting, I use the patented Finnglish fish call to draw them to the boat. " Suuweee  kula, kula, kula "  If I lose one it's   " satana perkele "  or " sonomabeech "

Apparently, according to Paul who says I drive him nuts with this, is I tend to say:  I think I have a fish on, or I might have a fish on."  He jokes and says "So you think you might possibly, maybe, perchance have a fish on, or not."  Otherwise, I also go "oop, got one." (that's for when I definately know)  Joey
